Creating new topics

Parent topic: Working with DITA topics

To create a new topic

  1. Choose File > New.
  2. Go to Framework templates > DITA for Flow > topic_templates.
  3. Select the information type of the topic that you want to create.
  4. Choose a name for the topic.
    Note: Keep in mind the Guidelines for file naming.
  5. Save your topic in the correct language folder ('en', 'nl', 'fr', â€¦).
    Note: Keep in mind the correct structure of your DITA folder (How is the Flow custom framework built?).
  6. Click Create.
    Oxygen opens a .dita file of the selected information type. It already contains some elements that are specific for that information type.
Related concepts
  • What is a topic?

What is an editing mode?

Once you have created a DITA topic in oXygen, you can look at and edit that topic in different editing modes. Each editing mode shows the topic in a specific way:

Editing mode Description
Text editing mode Shows the XML source of the topic.
Grid editing mode Shows the topic as a structured grid of nested tables.
Author editing mode Shows the topic in a WYSIWYG like editor.

To edit topics, it is easiest to use the Author editing mode. It can be interesting, however, to check how a particular element looks in the XML source of your topic with the Text editing mode.

Related concepts
  • What is a topic?
Related tasks
  • To select an editing mode

To select an editing mode

  1. Open the file you want to view in a specific editing mode.
  2. Click the Text, Grid or Author button at the bottom of the Editor area.
